channel.title: Best way to write a colour bot?
channel.description:
Basically, i'm talking about the actual loader.
What i'm seeing most people do is "xbootstrap" the java.awt.Canvas class, then make the getGraphics() draw to a static bufferedimage and then access that by doing; java.awt.Canvas.paintedGraphics then drawing that to a different panel.
That seems like it's probably quite unefficient, but can anyone suggest a different way?

item.title: Best way to write a colour bot?
item.dc:creator: @i_own_pking i_own_pking
item.description:
@i_own_pking wrote:

Ollie:

he never specified what language, but yes it is windows only.

Yeah suppose i should have. Would prefer Java only. So, i’m guessing what i’ve posted is pretty much the best way.

Read full topic

item.title: Best way to write a colour bot?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Ollie:

grab the HWND of the window and get its device context

Isn’t that a windows-only and native-code-only solution though? Not what you’d want for a Java Bot.

Read full topic
